alert.note: Alert for Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 08 at 3:24PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Orange and Osceola. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Ocoee, Winter Garden, Windermere, Bay Lake, Oak Ridge, Pine Hills, Celebration, Lockhart, Four Corners, Oakland, Bay Hill, Doctor Phillips, Universal Studios, Wet N Wild Water Park, Horizon West, Sea World, Orlovista, Pine Castle and Fairview Shores. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
